info.title: API7 Enterprise Admin APIs
info.description: API7 Enterprise Admin APIs are RESTful APIs that allow you to create and manage API7 resources.

post.summary: Create a published service on a gateway group.

parameters.name: gateway_group_id
parameters.description: It's optional when client authenticate with gateway group admin key.

hosts.description: The hosts for the service to accept incoming requests.

path_prefix.description: The listening path prefix of the service.

strip_path_prefix.description: Weather strip the path prefix or not when proxying the request to the upstream.

plugins.description: The key-value pairs which represent the plugins attached on the object.

upstream.description:
The upstream contains necessary information for the gateway to proxy
request to the backend service.

scheme.description: The protocol that is used for communicating with the backend service when the service type is `http`.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.

retries.description: The number of retries while passing the request to an upstream using the underlying Nginx mechanism.

timeout.description: The timeout settings for connecting to, and sending and receiving messages to and from the upstream (in seconds).

retry_timeout.description: Timeout to continue with retries. Setting this to 0 disables the retry timeout.

pass_host.description:
Define how to decide the host header before forwarding requests to an upstream.
* `pass` uses the host specified in the service.
* `node` uses the host specified in the upstream.
* `rewrite` uses custom host.

upstream_host.description: Only valid if the `pass_host` is `rewrite`. It indicates what value to rewrite the host header to.

items.description: The definition for an upstream endpoint.

service_name.description: Only valid for service discovery. Used to indicate how services are discovered in the service registry.

oneOf.description: The certificate in PEM format.
The private key in PEM format.

timeout.description: The timeout period of the active check (in second).

concurrency.description: The number of targets to be checked at the same time during the active check.

port.description: By default, the port is the same as the one defined in the upstream target.

http_path.description: The HTTP path in HTTP probe requests.

https_verify_certificate.description: Whether to verify the target's TLS certificate.

items.description: format -> key: value, for example, user-agent: go/1.20

interval.description: The time interval for checking healthy targets (in seconds).

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is successful.

successes.description: The number of successful probes to define a healthy target.

interval.description: The time interval for checking unhealthy targets (in seconds).

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is failed.

http_failures.description: The number of HTTP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

tcp_failures.description: The number of TCP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

timeouts.description: The number of probe timeouts to define an unhealthy target.

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is successful.

successes.description: The number of successful probes to define a healthy target.

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is failed.

tcp_failures.description: The number of TCP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

timeouts.description: The number of probe timeouts to define an unhealthy target.

http_failures.description: The number of HTTP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.  When the value is `chash`, the `hash_on` and `key` fields need to be assigned.

hash_on.description: Only valid if the type is `chash`.  Define what to use as hashing input. Supports Nginx variables (`vars`), custom headers (`header`), `cookie`, `consumer`, `vars_combinations`. Defaults to vars.

key.description: The key is used for consistent hash, which can be combined using variables, such as $host$uri. Finds the corresponding node id according to hash_on and key values. When hash_on is set to vars,  key is a required parameter and it supports Nginx variables. When hash_on is set as header,  key is a required parameter, and header name can be customized. When hash_on is set to cookie,  key is also a required parameter, and cookie name can be customized. When hash_on is set to consumer,  key need not be set and the key used by the hash algorithm would be the authenticated consumer_name.

get.summary: List all published services on a gateway group.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number, starting from 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The page size. It must be greater than 0.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: It should be ascending or descending (case-insensitive). By default, it is set to descending.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search keyword.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.  When the value is `chash`, the `hash_on` and `key` fields need to be assigned.

hash_on.description: Only valid if the type is `chash`.  Define what to use as hashing input. Supports Nginx variables (`vars`), custom headers (`header`), `cookie`, `consumer`, `vars_combinations`. Defaults to vars.

key.description: The key is used for consistent hash, which can be combined using variables, such as $host$uri. Finds the corresponding node id according to hash_on and key values. When hash_on is set to vars,  key is a required parameter and it supports Nginx variables. When hash_on is set as header,  key is a required parameter, and header name can be customized. When hash_on is set to cookie,  key is also a required parameter, and cookie name can be customized. When hash_on is set to consumer,  key need not be set and the key used by the hash algorithm would be the authenticated consumer_name.

When hash_on is set to vars,  key is a required parameter and it supports Nginx variables. When hash_on is set as header,  key is a required parameter, and header name can be customized. When hash_on is set to cookie,  key is also a required parameter, and cookie name can be customized. When hash_on is set to consumer,  key need not be set and the key used by the hash algorithm would be the authenticated consumer_name.

The upstream contains necessary information for the gateway to proxy
request to the backend service.

retries.description: The number of retries while passing the request to an upstream using the underlying Nginx mechanism.

timeout.description: The timeout settings for connecting to, and sending and receiving messages to and from the upstream (in seconds).

retry_timeout.description: Timeout to continue with retries. Setting this to 0 disables the retry timeout.

pass_host.description:
Define how to decide the host header before forwarding requests to an upstream.
* `pass` uses the host specified in the service.
* `node` uses the host specified in the upstream.
* `rewrite` uses custom host.

upstream_host.description: Only valid if the `pass_host` is `rewrite`. It indicates what value to rewrite the host header to.

service_name.description: Only valid for service discovery. Used to indicate how services are discovered in the service registry.

get.summary: List all gateway instances of all gateway groups.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The value of the instance status.

parameters.name: compatibility
parameters.description: The compatibility of the gateway instance version.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: It should be ascending or descending (case-insensitive). By default, it is set to descending.

parameters.description: The page size. It must be greater than 0.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number, starting from 1.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search keyword.

allOf.description: The outer structure for encapsulating a list of resources.

hostname.description: The hostname of the gateway instance.

ip.description: The IP address of the gateway instance.

gateway_group_id.description: The gateway group ID of the gateway instance.

version.description: The version of the gateway instance.

ports.description: The listening ports of the gateway instance.

last_heartbeat_time.description: The last heartbeat time of the gateway instance.

last_retrieve_config_time.description: The time the gateway instance last got its configuration

to_be_deleted_at.description: The duration to delete offline instances from the instance list.

created_at.description: The first heartbeat time of the gateway instance.

dataplane_certificate_expire_time.description: The expiration time of the certificate used for mTLS connection between the data plane and the control plane.

status.description:
Status enumeration:
- Healthy: indicates the gateway instance is healthy. Note Healthy means
  the heartbeat probes sent from instance are received periodically and the configuration delivery is also normal (configuration revision synced).
- OutOfSync: indicates the gateway instance sends heartbeat probes
  periodically but the configuration cannot be delivered to the instance (configuration revision out of synced).
- LostConnection: indicates the gateway instance loses heartbeat in short time ( 2 minutes < t < 2 hours )
- Offline: indicates the gateway instance loses heartbeat in long time ( 2 hours < t < 7 days )

Please note that gateway instances that have been offline for more than 7 days will be removed from the system and will not be included in this API.

compatibility.description:
Compatibility enumeration:
- Compatible: The gateway instance is fully compatible with the control plane, and all functionalities operate as expected.
- Incompatible: The gateway instance is not compatible with the control plane, and critical functionalities may not work.
- PartiallyCompatible: The gateway instance has limited compatibility with the control plane, and some functionalities may not work as expected.

schema.description: The object ID.

allOf.description: The outer structure for encapsulating the specific resource.

hosts.description: The hosts for the service to accept incoming requests.

path_prefix.description: The listening path prefix of the service.

strip_path_prefix.description: Weather strip the path prefix or not when proxying the request to the upstream.

upstream.description:
The upstream contains necessary information for the gateway to proxy
request to the backend service.

scheme.description: The protocol that is used for communicating with the backend service when the service type is `http`.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.

retries.description: The number of retries while passing the request to an upstream using the underlying Nginx mechanism.

timeout.description: The timeout settings for connecting to, and sending and receiving messages to and from the upstream (in seconds).

retry_timeout.description: Timeout to continue with retries. Setting this to 0 disables the retry timeout.

pass_host.description:
Define how to decide the host header before forwarding requests to an upstream.
* `pass` uses the host specified in the service.
* `node` uses the host specified in the upstream.
* `rewrite` uses custom host.

upstream_host.description: Only valid if the `pass_host` is `rewrite`. It indicates what value to rewrite the host header to.

items.description: The definition for an upstream endpoint.

service_name.description: Only valid for service discovery. Used to indicate how services are discovered in the service registry.

oneOf.description: The certificate in PEM format.
The private key in PEM format.

timeout.description: The timeout period of the active check (in second).

concurrency.description: The number of targets to be checked at the same time during the active check.

port.description: By default, the port is the same as the one defined in the upstream target.

http_path.description: The HTTP path in HTTP probe requests.

https_verify_certificate.description: Whether to verify the target's TLS certificate.

items.description: format -> key: value, for example, user-agent: go/1.20

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is successful.

successes.description: The number of successful probes to define a healthy target.

interval.description: The time interval for checking unhealthy targets (in seconds).

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is failed.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.  When the value is `chash`, the `hash_on` and `key` fields need to be assigned.

hash_on.description: Only valid if the type is `chash`.  Define what to use as hashing input. Supports Nginx variables (`vars`), custom headers (`header`), `cookie`, `consumer`, `vars_combinations`. Defaults to vars.

key.description: The key is used for consistent hash, which can be combined using variables, such as $host$uri. Finds the corresponding node id according to hash_on and key values. When hash_on is set to vars,  key is a required parameter and it supports Nginx variables. When hash_on is set as header,  key is a required parameter, and header name can be customized. When hash_on is set to cookie,  key is also a required parameter, and cookie name can be customized. When hash_on is set to consumer,  key need not be set and the key used by the hash algorithm would be the authenticated consumer_name.

plugins.description: The key-value pairs which represent the plugins attached on the object.

hosts.description: The hosts for the service to accept incoming requests.

path_prefix.description: The listening path prefix of the service.

strip_path_prefix.description: Weather strip the path prefix or not when proxying the request to the upstream.

upstream.description:
The upstream contains necessary information for the gateway to proxy
request to the backend service.

scheme.description: The protocol that is used for communicating with the backend service when the service type is `http`.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.

retries.description: The number of retries while passing the request to an upstream using the underlying Nginx mechanism.

timeout.description: The timeout settings for connecting to, and sending and receiving messages to and from the upstream (in seconds).

retry_timeout.description: Timeout to continue with retries. Setting this to 0 disables the retry timeout.

pass_host.description:
Define how to decide the host header before forwarding requests to an upstream.
* `pass` uses the host specified in the service.
* `node` uses the host specified in the upstream.
* `rewrite` uses custom host.

upstream_host.description: Only valid if the `pass_host` is `rewrite`. It indicates what value to rewrite the host header to.

items.description: The definition for an upstream endpoint.

service_name.description: Only valid for service discovery. Used to indicate how services are discovered in the service registry.

oneOf.description: The certificate in PEM format.
The private key in PEM format.

timeout.description: The timeout period of the active check (in second).

concurrency.description: The number of targets to be checked at the same time during the active check.

port.description: By default, the port is the same as the one defined in the upstream target.

http_path.description: The HTTP path in HTTP probe requests.

https_verify_certificate.description: Whether to verify the target's TLS certificate.

items.description: format -> key: value, for example, user-agent: go/1.20

interval.description: The time interval for checking healthy targets (in seconds).

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is successful.

successes.description: The number of successful probes to define a healthy target.

interval.description: The time interval for checking unhealthy targets (in seconds).

http_statuses.description: A list of HTTP status codes. It's used for checking if an HTTP probe request is failed.

http_failures.description: The number of HTTP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

tcp_failures.description: The number of TCP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

timeouts.description: The number of probe timeouts to define an unhealthy target.

successes.description: The number of successful probes to define a healthy target.

tcp_failures.description: The number of TCP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

timeouts.description: The number of probe timeouts to define an unhealthy target.

http_failures.description: The number of HTTP-related failures to define an unhealthy target.

type.description: The load balancing algorithm to distribute traffic to targets.  When the value is `chash`, the `hash_on` and `key` fields need to be assigned.

hash_on.description: Only valid if the type is `chash`.  Define what to use as hashing input. Supports Nginx variables (`vars`), custom headers (`header`), `cookie`, `consumer`, `vars_combinations`. Defaults to vars.

key.description: The key is used for consistent hash, which can be combined using variables, such as $host$uri. Finds the corresponding node id according to hash_on and key values. When hash_on is set to vars,  key is a required parameter and it supports Nginx variables. When hash_on is set as header,  key is a required parameter, and header name can be customized. When hash_on is set to cookie,  key is also a required parameter, and cookie name can be customized. When hash_on is set to consumer,  key need not be set and the key used by the hash algorithm would be the authenticated consumer_name.
